Content.title: She looked everywhere
Content.info: There's no page here. Maybe it was moved or it never existed. That's how it is sometimes.

Intro.heading: I like to make stuff
Intro.text1: Putting my work out there for the world to see and seeing people around the world enjoy what I do brings me lots of joy and motivates me to continue and improve my craft.
Intro.text2: Most of the things I create are made just for fun and on an all rights reserved basis, with a very specific exception to allow people to use my 3D renders as wallpapers on personal use desktops or phones.
Intro.text3: Some people seem to think, though, that if anything is put on the internet that automatically means anyone can do whatever they want with it.
Intro.text4: And I take issue with that.

Copyright.heading: I like my copyright
Copyright.text1: As described on the <gallery>Gallery</gallery> page and in the FAQ on the <contact>Contact</contact> page, I'm pretty restrictive in regards to what other people can do with my work. Generally, unless it's something that has a download button at the bottom of the page (like most of my fonts for instance) you're not allowed to reuse, resell or redistribute my work without permission, neither personally or commercially.
Copyright.text2: Until now I thought it should go without saying that you can't just use other people's work without the permission of the original author, but here's my declaration in case it wasn't obvious to all those AI companies and data harvesters out there:

Disallow.heading: I hereby prohibit and opt out of any form of data mining, scraping or reproduction of my work
Disallow.text: Unless otherwise specified in any explicit licensing terms, without my prior written permission you are not allowed to use any of my work (including but not limited to any written text, 2D and 3D renders, animations, motion graphics and any other downloadable content on this website, as well as content that I choose to host on third-party websites) for any purposes, both personal or commercial, including purposes related to the training and/or development of artificial intelligence (AI) of any kind, to the extent permitted by applicable law.

Ask.heading: Just ask
Ask.text: In case the above wasn't clear enough, you may message me to ask for clarifications or inquire about permission to use some of my work for a specific purpose. Better be safe than sorry.

Head.description: TL;DR: Don't.
Head.title: AI training declaration
Website for Autsellia
Head.description: An artist friend and supposedly a fox girl.

Intro.title: About these icons.
Intro.text1: Many applications out there follow their own design language, from the design of the app itself to its icon. For the latter, I want to create a more uniform look (and also make sure that not every video editor from Adobe looks like Media Encoder). Controversial to hear this from a Windows user, I know. Consistency? In Windows? Hilarious.
Intro.text2: These icons loosely follow the guidelines for Windows app icons. Click on a few icons to select them and then download them below.
Intro.text3: More symbols will be added over time if I feel like it.

Dialog.title: Caffeine addiction.
Dialog.text1: Hiya. Making all of these icons was a lot of work. I'm releasing them for free, but if you're feeling generous and want to support me and my work, a coffee would be really appreciated.
Dialog.text2: Click the button below to visit my Ko-fi page.

Head.description: Because you can never have enough useless easter eggs.
Head.title: Calculator

NoTalky.answer: I'm useless anyways, so get lost.

WhoYou.answer: Name's Mina. I'm basically the mascot of the guy running this website, pprmint. His actual name is Nicklas, but prefers to be called Nick.

WhyPprmint.answer: Because he likes peppermint-flavored things and "peppermint" looked cooler if you removed all the vowels except for the i. The period at the end is part of the name, as punctuation is right below peppermint in that list.

WhoWebsite.answer: This version of the site was built from the ground up using Next.js in August of 2022 and has been in continuous development since then. Try clicking on the cup in the footer to see all the packages used to make all this.

UseSelf.message: May I use the graphics and animations in my own works?
UseSelf.answer: No, (almost) everything you see on the <gallery>gallery page</gallery> is just for looking at. You could use the 3D renders as desktop wallpapers for instance, but that's it.

ProjectTerms.message: Under which conditions may projects such as fonts and icons be used?
ProjectTerms.answer: Fonts are licensed under the <sil>SIL Open Font License</sil>. You may freely use those even commercially. A copy of the license is included with the ZIP. It's a different story with projects like Mintcraft or the app icons. You may use the app icons for free and modify them to your needs. However, you may not sell or otherwise redistribute them. Please link back to the respective project page if you want to share stuff. Mintcraft is licensed under the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA license.

WhatSoftware.message: What software is typically used to create stuff around here?
WhatSoftware.answer: Anything 2D is done using Affinity Designer. Motion graphics compositions are also usually prepared in Affinity Designer and then animated in Adobe After Effects, with the help of Mt. Mograph's Motion plugin. Fonts are created using FontForge.

OfferCommissions.answer: Not currently, however it's planned for sometime in the future.

OwnQuestion.message: Can I ask my own question?

Disclaimer.heading: Disclaimer
Disclaimer.termsAgree: You have to agree to the following conditions before you may submit a commission request.
Disclaimer.acknowledgement: By submitting a commission request you acknowledge to have read and accepted the following terms and conditions.
Disclaimer.rightToWithdraw: I reserve the right to decline or withdraw from a commission at any time and for any reason.
Disclaimer.noRefund: Refunds are only granted under certain conditions, not however after work on a project has begun. More on that below.

Payment.heading: Payment
Payment.preferredMethod: The preferred payment method is PayPal. Payments must be sent in EUR. Any transfer fees will be handled by me.

Refunds.heading: Refunds
Refunds.preamble: Either party is allowed to withdraw from a commission at any time and for any reason. However, refunds will only be granted under certain circumstances.
Refunds.notStarted: If the order is cancelled before I have started working on it and the initial payment has already been made, I will refund the initial payment in full.
Refunds.hasStarted: There are no refunds once work on a commission has already begun. Upon request, I'll provide the (possibly unfinished) files I've worked on up to that point for a fee relative to the total price.

Head.description: My leafy mascot.
Head.title: Mina

About.heading: About Mina
About.text1: Born on the 11th of June 2004 with green hair and blue eyes, she's a rather laid-back and quiet girl currently standing about 160 cm tall. She moved from Japan to Germany a long time ago, but only speaks English and German fluently. Through her long stay in Germany, she also had plenty of time to acquire a number of lovely German insults. Used sparingly, they make sure that certain people will voluntarily never exchange another word with her.
About.text2: She likes to eat mint-flavored treats, especially chocolate chip mint ice cream. Mina also always keeps a pack of gum in her pocket, though her chewing gum bubbles are rarely larger than a centimeter. Meat dishes also raise her appetite quite a bit.
About.text3: Mina is fascinated by architecture and interior design, finding joy in conceptualizing modern living spaces. There are plans for how every room in her dream house should look, not to mention the design of the house itself.
About.text4: However, she does have issues committing to something and is quite easy to distract. Some days she may plan on doing something, only to then do anything but.
About.text6: The design was created by <Link>@wxsonz</Link>. Please take a look at his Twitter profile for more of his work.

Outfit.heading: Regular outfit
Outfit.text1: Mina's clothes are usually rather dark; A combination of dark grey, white and green.
Outfit.text2: Her regular outfit consists of a comfy hooded jacket with grey fluff inside, featuring green lines around the hood and lower edge of the jacket and skirt, and more green for the sleeves.
Outfit.text3: To match, her thigh-high stockings are decorated with vertical lines that have my leaf logo just above the knee.
Outfit.text4: She almost always wears at least one ring, their designs varying greatly. In combination with her regular outfit she usually just wears a silver rectangular ring that's worn on both middle and ring finger.
Outfit.text5: Even though the jacket is throwing any professionalism out the window, she still likes to wear a fancy tie. Adds 20 points to the FancyScore™.

Rings.heading: Rings
Rings.text1: Her standard ring is plain rectangular, worn on both the ring and middle finger.
Rings.text2: If you have a certain theme or outfit in mind for any art you draw, you're free to change the design to match it. How many rings there and on which fingers is up to you.
Rings.text3: You may also omit the ring entirely, though at least one is generally preferred.

Hairbow.heading: Hair bow and ponytail
Hairbow.text1: Her hair bow is (somehow) tied in such a way that a leaf shape peeks out at the top. Her ponytail is also tied a little to the left (when viewed from behind). That way it can still be seen to the right behind her head when looking at her face to face.
Hairbow.text2: The center point of the knot is highlighted red.

Shoes.heading: Shoes
Shoes.text1: Instead of a hanger that nobody ever uses, you can find a little leaf attached to the back, along with some other green accents.
Shoes.text2: Like with other parts of her outfit, feel free to change the design to match your own vision.

Color.text: There's also a <Link>palette page</Link> if you'd like something more exhaustive.

Download.text: Would you like to have this overview with all details as a single image? Look no further:

Fanart.heading: Fanart rules
Fanart.text1: I don't really have any rules for you if you plan on drawing SFW art with Mina. Knock yourself out.
Fanart.text2: You may also draw things with Mina that should rather not be seen at work. Just try to keep it tasteful and wholesome, and don't create anything that can be considered fetishistic or otherwise sensitive, or that might disturb or upset some people.
Fanart.text3: If you want something more precise, please don't depict any of the following:
Fanart.text4: Rape, physical or psychological abuse, drug consumption, blackmail, prostitution, violence, gore, blood, scat, NTR/cheating, loli and shota.
Fanart.text5: Non-exhaustive list. There may be even more rancid stuff out there, their existence unbeknownst to me. I'd like to keep it that way, so keep those out of my sight.
Fanart.text6: Please also avoid any religious or political symbols and references.

Artworks.last7Days: Fanart drawn in the last 7 days:

Dialog.title: Looks like that checkbox made you a bit curious
Dialog.text1: Some things are better left unseen. Especially if you're in public or otherwise at risk of someone peeking over your shoulder.
Dialog.text2: Ticking this box will reveal suggestive and lewd (NSFW) artwork on the page. If you're fine with that, please sell your soul using the green button below in a few seconds.
Dialog.text3: If you're under the age of 18, close this pop-up.
Dialog.hint: Hint: If there's a keyboard in front of you, you only have one hand free and suddenly need to abort your mission, press the space bar to hide the smut again.
Dialog.credit: The art of Mina judging you up there was drawn by <Link>@wxsonz</Link>.

Discord.heading: Give your messages a touch of green
Discord.text: Got Discord Nitro? Join the emote server and start using Mina stickers and emojis anywhere you want.

Head.description: A pixel font.

About.heading: About this pack
About.text1: The default light-grey backgrounds used for containers along with the irregular rounded corners never really spoke to me.
About.text3: Mintcraft is a resource pack I made mostly to fit my own taste, but has proven to be liked by at least 3 other beings of human nature within this galaxy.
About.text4: Taking some inspiration from the Minecraft Launcher's giant PLAY button, Mintcraft aims to provide a consistent dark mode and slightly refreshed look to the Minecraft UI.
About.text5: Stress being on UI: This pack mainly affects the solid backgrounds of the options and world/server selection screens. If you'd like, you can also apply my take at the Minecraft Seven font, <Link>Mintbit</Link>, and a new button click sound via add-ons. Or download the Complete version to get all of that in one handy ZIP.

Credits.heading: Special thanks
Credits.blizzy: For his custom song in the Sounds add-on. More to follow. Hopefully.
Credits.vanillaTweaks: For fixing the text color on dark backgrounds.

MayContainMistakes.heading: May contain mistakes and bad decisions
MayContainMistakes.text: If you have some feedback or found something that looks to be an error, feel free to <Link>send me a message</Link>.

Download.heading: Want?
Download.text: Download Mintcraft either from Modrinth or the GitHub releases.

Head.description: A sans-serif font.
Head.title: Mintsans

Intro.heading: This is a very specific font
Intro.text1: I like the design of osu!lazer, particularly its <Link>score counter</Link>, so I made a font that I could use for my lockscreen.
Intro.text3: As this is a font made to serve one purpose, the character set is quite limited. Nevertheless, it might prove to be helpful for your own purposes.

Wireframe.heading: Wireframe
Wireframe.text: Typing a <key>*</key> will bring up a wireframe glyph that can be placed behind any digits for aesthetics. It's slightly thinner than the stroke width of the digits themselves. If you need one that's the same thickness, type a <key>#</key> instead.

Punctuation.heading: Punctuation
Punctuation.text: You could show the time, fractions... or something that requires a semicolon. I don't know what that could be, but it's there if you need it. Semicolons are cool.

Special.heading: Special characters
Special.text: In the event that numbers alone aren't cutting it, I've also included some math symbols and slashes that you can use. Useful for showing things like differences or multipliers.

Download.heading: When you see it
Download.text: I've been told that's a reference. Anyway, here's the download button.

Head.description: Learn about what data is processed upon your visit.
Head.title: Privacy policy

Tldr.heading: TL;DR:
Tldr.text1: I make use of Vercel and Contabo for hosting the website and media on it, Fastmail for sending and receiving emails, and Cloudflare as a DNS proxy.
Tldr.text2: The only personally identifiable data I receive and have access to is the data you send to me via the contact form or by email directly, such as name, email address and whatever you write in the message field. Unless we agreed on something else, these messages will automatically be deleted after 60 days.
Tldr.text3: Vercel and Cloudflare may process and store details such as your public IP address, browser type and the time of request, as is required for the respective service to function and for purposes in their interest. Cloudflare is used as a proxy between your browser and the server I use to host my CMS along with images and videos.

General.heading: General.
General.text1: This website does not collect any personal data, be it through analytics, advertising, trackers, cookies, fingerprinting or similar. IP addresses may be processed and stored by third party providers while accessing this site. More on that in the Hosting section below.
General.text2: The only personal data that I have direct access to is that which you send me via the contact form or directly via email, such as your name, email address and the content of the message. My email inbox is with Fastmail (Fastmail Pty. Ltd., PO Box 234, Collins St West, Victoria 8007, Australia) and emails will be deleted automatically after 60 days unless we agreed on something else in replies.
General.text3: Parts of this website may contain links to external websites, such as social media profiles or websites of artists and other projects. No responsibility is taken for the content on such sites. You will also be subject to their respective privacy policies and not those of pprmint.de.

Hosting.heading: Hosting.
Hosting.text1: The website itself is hosted by Vercel (Vercel, Inc., 340 S Lemon Ave #4133, Walnut, CA 91789, USA). I also use a CMS hosted on a cloud server from Contabo (Contabo GmbH, Aschauer Straße 32a, 81549 Munich, Germany), which is located in an EU data center and hosts most images and videos on this site.
Hosting.text2: To protect against DDoS attacks and optimize loading times, I use Cloudflare (Cloudflare, Inc., 101 Townsend St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA), which provide a proxy for requests between you and my CMS server. Requests sent to it will first pass through Cloudflare, who may collect the IP address of visitors for analysis and security purposes.
Hosting.text3: The use of these services for their respective purpose is based on my legitimate interest in being able to offer this website as error-free, fast and secure as possible. (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR)

Contact.heading: Contact.
Contact.text1: If you have any privacy-related questions, please feel free to send an email to privacy[at]pprmint.de.
Contact.text2: Please use the above email address only for that purpose and not to send general questions, advers, offers, spam or the like.

Head.title: Trade offer
Head.description: I receive a Ko-fi donation, you receive early versions of Mina Sans and the full family once it releases.

Intro.youReceiveSub2: the full family once it's ready

How.heading: How this is gonna work
How.text1: I've recently gotten my hands on a Mac, which allowed me to finally ditch Windows for any productive work. Switching to a Mac also means that I could use more professional software to create fonts.
How.text2: Specifically, I'd like to purchase <Link>Glyphs</Link> so I can get more serious about font design and creation. Glyphs is not only much more pleasant to use than the things I've been dealing with before, it also allows me to create fonts with more features, more easily, and most importantly, variable fonts which FontForge doesn't natively support.
How.text3: However, buying Glyphs would be an investment, and a potential return on investment would be nice.
How.text4: Mina Sans is going to be my first paid font. My goal is to create a variable font with features like character variants, contextual alternatives and tabular numbers, with extended Latin coverage. Considering the amount of work that would go into this, I think €25-30 would be a fair price for the final product (especially considering what most other font foundries tend to charge).
How.text5: If you'd like to help me afford Glyphs I'd greatly appreaciate any Ko-fi donations. If you feel extra generous and would like to try Mina Sans before anyone else, €15 would give you access to early versions as I create them and net you a chance to influence the final design with your feedback.
How.text6: My heartfelt thanks along with links to download the font will be sent to the email address used for your donation. If you don't hear from me after 2 days, please <Link>contact me</Link>.
How.text7: To set expecations straight: Creating fonts takes a lot of time and effort. I might not release updates very frequently and it might take a long time until there's a production-ready version. I only have so much free time and want to make Mina Sans the best it can be, so I ask for your patience.

License.heading: License
License.text: You'll receive Desktop and Web licenses with the following respective terms:

Desktop.heading: Desktop-Lizenz
Desktop.tldr: Persönliche und kommerzielle Projekte, kein Teilen oder Weiterverkauf, keine Konvertierung in andere Formate.

Web.heading: Web-Lizenz
Web.tldr: Eine Website, unendliche Page-Views, keine zusätzlichen Websites unter Subdomains oder Unterordnern, keine Konvertierung in andere Formate.

Head.title: Website and branding for Tentative
Head.description: A group of indecisive creatives, including yours truly.
Take a look at (almost) all my creations.
Head.title: Works

About.heading: Terminals scare you?
About.text1: Not me (Arch btw). However, I do hate Windows, which makes the idea of me working on a project like this almost seem unholy.
About.text2: Anyway, one day someone asked me to recommend a good video downloader. I recommended <Link>yt-dlp</Link>, which is a fork of a fork of the youtube-dl project. The "downside" is that it's a command line app.
About.text3: After about a decade since my last contact with C#, I present to you my yt-dlp frontend, aiming to be as easy to use as possible.
About.text4: Yes, I am aware other GUIs already exist. Now shush.

Roadmap.heading: Roadmap.
Roadmap.savingSettings: Remember the last used settings for download type, formats and output folder.
Roadmap.tempFolder: Download files to a temporary folder before moving them to the chosen output folder.
Roadmap.autoUpdater: Detect new releases on GitHub and allow you to either download and install them manually, or do so with one or two clicks.
Roadmap.translations: Translation to German with language detection from the OS.
Roadmap.fullSupport: Fully support downloading or converting videos in the selected format and resolution, converting using FFmpeg if required.
Roadmap.youTellMe: You tell me. I'm open to suggestions.

Download.heading: Download from GitHub.
Download.text: You can always find the latest installer on the releases page of the repo.
